com.mousebird.maply

Class VectorObject

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.mousebird.maply.VectorObject
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Iterable<VectorObject>

    public class VectorObject
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Iterable<VectorObject>
    The Maply VectorObject represents a group of vector features. There can be a single point in here, multiple points, or even a combination of points, areals, and linears.

    You can create these yourself, but they are typically read from data files, such as GeoJSON or Shapefiles.

    The VectorObject is meant to be somewhat opaque (but not as opaque as originally planned). If you need to do a lot of manipulation of your vector data, it's best ot do it elsewhere and then convert to a VectorObject.

      • iterator

        public VectorIterator iterator()
        Vector objects can be made of lots of smaller objects. If you need to access each of this individually, this iterator will handle that efficiently.
        Specified by:
        iterator in interface java.lang.Iterable<VectorObject>

      • centroid

        public Point2d centroid()
        Calculate the centroid of the object. This assumes we've got at least one areal loop.
        Returns:
        Centroid of the object.

      • largestLoopCenter

        public Point2d largestLoopCenter(Point2d ll,
                        Point2d ur)
        Find the largest loop and return its center. Also returns the bounding box the loop.
        Parameters:
        ll - Lower left corner of the largest loop.
        ur - Upper right corner of the largest loop.
        Returns:
        Center of the largest loop.

      • linearMiddle

        public double linearMiddle(Point2d middle)
        Calculate the midpoint of a multi-point line. Also return the rotation.
        Parameters:
        middle - Midpoint of the line
        Returns:
        Orientation along the long at that point

        Parameters:

      • readFromFile

        public boolean readFromFile(java.lang.String fileName)
        Read vector objects from a binary file. This is fairly efficient and a good way to cache data.
        Parameters:
        fileName - The file to read vector data from.
        Returns:
        true on success, false otherwise.

      • writeToFile

        public boolean writeToFile(java.lang.String fileName)
        Write a vector object to a binary file. This is fairly efficient for caching data, but not to be used for much else.
        Parameters:
        fileName - The file to write data to.
        Returns:
        true on success, false otherwise.
